titlestmt.title: Collection List for the Philadelphia Museum of Art

publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: 2012 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

figure.teiform: Exterior of the Philadelphia Museum of Art

div1.head: Illuminated Books
div1.bibl: Europe, copy c. Plates 13 and 14 printed recto/verso. Accession no. 1955-57-3
Songs of Innocence and of Experience, posthumous copy o. Plates 28 and 52.Accession nos. 1975-26-18 and 1975-26-19
Jerusalem. Plate 99, a posthumous impression.Accession no. 1975-26-21

div2.head: Designed and Engraved by Blake
div2.bibl: Hayley, William. Little Tom the Sailor (broadside, damaged and partly restored with facsimiles at top and bottom).1800. Accession no. 1960-139-77

Virgil. The Pastorals of Virgil. 1821. Blake's 1st, 4th, 6th, 8th, 11th, 15th and 17th wood engravings (plates 5, 8, 10, 12, 15, 22, and 24) only, Linnell impressions. Accession nos. 1875-11 through 17

div2.head: Designed by Blake and Engraved by Other Engravers
div2.bibl: Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1813. Plate 8 only.Accession no. 1985-52-37475

div2.head: Engraved by Blake after Designs by Other Artists
div2.bibl: Hayley, William. The Life and Posthumous Writings of William Cowper. 1803-04. Blake's plates 1 and 4 only.Accession nos. 1985-52-37472 and 1985-52-37474
Hayley, William. The Life of George Romney. 1809. Blake's plate only.Accession no. 1985-52-37470
Hogarth, William. The Original Works. 1790. Blake's plate only, "Beggar's Opera, Act III". 2 impressions, 1st proof state and 1st published state.Accession nos. 1945-60-5 and 1958-153-3
Lavater, John Caspar. Aphorisms on Man. 1788. Plate only.Accession no. 1952-88-3
Lavater, John Caspar. Essays on Physiognomy. 1789-98. Blake's plate 2 ("Democritus") only.Accession no. 1985-52-37469
The Monthly Magazine and British Register. Vol. 4.1797. Blake's plate only.Accession no. 1985-52-37471
Shakespeare, William. The Dramatic Works. 1802 (i.e. 1803). Blake's plate only.Accession no. 1985-52-37468

div1.head: Separate Prints and Prints in Series

div2.head: Plates Designed and Engraved by Blake

bibl.title: The Accusers of Theft Adultery Murder
Chaucers Canterbury Pilgrims
bibl.note: and 2 Sessler impressions of the 5th state

bibl.title: Illustrations of the Book of Job
Illustrations of the Book of Job
bibl.note: Plates 11 ("Proof" printing on laid India) and 14 (after removal of the "Proof" inscription).

bibl.title: Illustrations of the Book of Job
Illustrations of the Book of Job

div2.head: Plates Engraved by Blake after Designs by Other Artists
div2.bibl: Evening Amusement. 2nd state.Accession no. 1953-72-652
The Idle Laundress. Probably 2nd state, color printed.Accession no. 1949-13-13
Industrious Cottager. 2 impressions, both 3rd state, color printed.Accession nos. 1949-13-12 and 1954-66-62

div2.head: Color Printed Drawings
div2.bibl: God Judging Adam. Accession no. 1964-110-5
Newton. No accession no.; on long term loan from the Lutheran Church in America

div2.head: Pencil Sketches
div2.bibl: Sketches for "The Bard", recto and verso.Accession no. 1950-134-3

div2.head: Monochrome Wash Drawings
div2.bibl: The Death of Ezekiel's Wife. Accession no. 1964-110-11
A Destroying Deity: A Winged Figure Grasping Thunderbolts. Accession no. 1964-110-7
The Sacrifice of Isaac. Accession no. 1964-110-8
Warring Angels: Michael Contending with Satan. Accession no. 1964-110-6

div2.head: Water Color Drawings
div2.bibl: Abraham and Isaac. Accession no. 1964-110-8
Christ Baptising. Accession no. 1964-110-2
Jephthah Met by His Daughter. Accession no. 1964-110-9
Malevolence. Accession no. 1964-110-3
Mary Magdalene Washing Christ's Feet. Accession no. 1964-110-10
Moses Striking the Rock. No accession no.; on long term loan from the Lutheran Church in America
Samson Subdued. Accession no. 1964-110-4
